title: Catalano tests prestige property market
text:
Former Domain boss Antony Catalano is quietly shopping his St Kilda West mansion around. Supplied

Many are watching the evolving spring housing market with interest. None more so, perhaps, than Antony Catalano, formerly of Domain but now the head and co-owner of the former Fairfax’s Australian Community Media regional paper business.

For all his rural moves, The Cat keeps close tabs on the country’s prestige markets. Why else would he be putting feelers out on his own ivy-covered pile in inner Melbourne’s delightful St Kilda West?

While The Cat is intending to move – he has, after all, signed up for a $30 million, 650-square-metre penthouse in Tim Gurner’s Saint Moritz development a stone’s throw away on the site of the former Novotel St Kilda – he's in no hurry. Construction has kicked off at the $550-million Saint Moritz , but completion is two years away. And if Catalano were to sell anytime soon, he’d have to either rent, camp out on the St Kilda foreshore or ask a buyer to agree to a very long settlement, which buyers of six-bedroom mansions tend to not want to do, particularly if they have their own large families to house.

So, he has time up his sleeve. But who knows. If someone were to offer him ... say, $20 million, he might be convinced to sell ...
description: Why else would he be putting feelers out on his own ivy-covered pile in inner Melbourne’s delightful St Kilda West?
